about.name: New York City
about.info_text: New York City, often referred to as the 'Big Apple,' is a bustling and diverse metropolis located in the state of New York. It's one of the most iconic cities in the world, known for its towering skyscrapers, cultural diversity, and endless opportunities for entertainment. From the bright lights of Times Square to the tranquility of Central Park, NYC offers an unparalleled urban experience.
about.facts_text:
Population: Over 8 million
State: New York
Time Zone: Eastern Time Zone (UTC-05:00)
Languages: English, Spanish, Chinese, and many more
Currency: United States Dollar (USD)
about.climate_text: New York City experiences all four seasons, with hot summers and cold winters. It's a city that comes to life with holiday decorations in the winter and offers outdoor events in the summer.

attractions_card.title: Times Square
attractions_card.description: Times Square is a world-famous commercial and entertainment hub, known for its iconic billboards, theaters, and the annual New Year's Eve ball drop.

attractions_card.title: Central Park
attractions_card.description: Central Park is a vast urban oasis in the heart of Manhattan, offering green spaces, walking paths, lakes, and numerous recreational activities.

attractions_card.title: Statue of Liberty
attractions_card.description: The Statue of Liberty is a symbol of freedom and democracy, located on Liberty Island, accessible by ferry tours from Battery Park.

attractions_card.title: Empire State Building
attractions_card.description: The Empire State Building is an iconic skyscraper, with an observation deck offering panoramic views of the city's skyline.

attractions_card.title: Broadway Theaters
attractions_card.description: Broadway is the epicenter of live theater and musical performances, featuring world-renowned productions in historic venues.

attractions_card.title: Metropolitan Museum of Art
attractions_card.description: The Met is one of the largest art museums in the world, housing an extensive collection of art and cultural artifacts.

attractions_card.title: Museum of Modern Art (MoMA)
attractions_card.description: MoMA is a renowned museum dedicated to modern and contemporary art, showcasing works by famous artists.

attractions_card.title: One World Trade Center
attractions_card.description: One World Trade Center, also known as Freedom Tower, stands as a symbol of resilience and offers a moving 9/11 Memorial Museum.

food_card.title: New York-style Pizza
food_card.description: New York-style pizza is characterized by its thin and foldable crust, often served by the slice and topped with various ingredients.

food_card.title: Bagels
food_card.description: New York's bagels are famous for their chewy texture and are best enjoyed with cream cheese, lox, or various spreads.

food_card.title: Hot Dogs
food_card.description: NYC street vendors are known for serving classic hot dogs, often topped with mustard, sauerkraut, onions, and more.

food_card.title: New York Cheesecake
food_card.description: New York cheesecake is a rich and creamy dessert, with a thick cream cheese filling on a graham cracker crust.

food_card.title: Deli Sandwiches
food_card.description: New York delis serve up hearty sandwiches with generous layers of meats, cheeses, and condiments.

hotels_card.title: The Plaza Hotel
hotels_card.description: The Plaza Hotel is a historic and luxurious landmark, offering opulent rooms, fine dining, and Central Park views.

hotels_card.title: Waldorf Astoria New York
hotels_card.description: The Waldorf Astoria is an iconic hotel known for its grandeur, featuring elegant accommodations and world-class amenities.

hotels_card.alt: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
hotels_card.title: The Ritz-Carlton New York, Central Park
hotels_card.description: The Ritz-Carlton offers a refined experience with a prime location overlooking Central Park and impeccable service.

hotels_card.alt: Four Seasons Hotel New York Downtown
hotels_card.title: Four Seasons Hotel New York Downtown
hotels_card.description: The Four Seasons in downtown Manhattan provides modern luxury, with stylish rooms and dining options.

hotels_card.alt: The Langham, New York, Fifth Avenue
hotels_card.title: The Langham, New York, Fifth Avenue
hotels_card.description: The Langham is a sophisticated hotel with elegant rooms and a convenient Midtown location.

hotels_card.title: The Standard, High Line
hotels_card.description: The Standard offers a modern and trendy atmosphere, with unique design and stunning views of the High Line and the Hudson River.

hotels_card.title: The NoMad Hotel
hotels_card.description: The NoMad Hotel combines luxury and creativity, featuring boutique accommodations and renowned dining experiences.

hotels_card.title: The Peninsula New York
hotels_card.description: The Peninsula New York is a classic and elegant hotel, offering lavish rooms, a spa, and fine dining.

transport_card.title: John F. Kennedy International Airport
transport_card.description: JFK Airport is one of the major airports serving New York City, providing international and domestic flight connections.

transport_card.title: LaGuardia Airport
transport_card.description: LaGuardia Airport offers domestic flights and is conveniently located in Queens, providing access to the city.

transport_card.title: Subway System
transport_card.description: New York City's extensive subway system is a fast and affordable way to navigate the city's boroughs and neighborhoods.

transport_card.title: Yellow Taxis
transport_card.description: The iconic yellow taxis of NYC are readily available and offer convenient transportation around the city.

transport_card.title: Buses
transport_card.description: NYC buses provide additional transportation options for reaching various destinations within the city.

transport_card.title: Citi Bike
transport_card.description: Citi Bike is a bike-sharing program that allows you to explore New York City on two wheels, with stations throughout the city.

transport_card.title: Ferries
transport_card.description: Ferry services connect Manhattan to nearby destinations, including Staten Island and Liberty Island, home to the Statue of Liberty.

transport_card.title: Grand Central Terminal
transport_card.description: Grand Central Terminal is a historic transportation hub, serving as a major train station and architectural masterpiece.
